samples.question: Do you think it is good to talk loudly on a bus?
samples.transcript: Well, I think, in my country, it is considered too, polite behavior. And, I really hate people when they, talk in public places, Like buses or maybe in cinemas. And it is very annoying for me when they rehash their talking and it makes me so uncomfortable. And if I had to, if I want to warn them, I would do that. And it is very annoying behavior, I guess.
samples.transcript_original: Um, well, I think, uh, in my country, it's considered too, um, um, polite behavior. And if I had to, if I want to warn them, I would do that. And it's very annoying behavior, I guess.

samples.question: So in your opinion, would it be a good idea to have laws that prevent speaking loudly in public?

So it is very important to them, and I think it is very necessary to give, to observe news or maybe some new events that it is important for us. samples.question: Were you thinking about the, the, were you thinking about it?
samples.transcript: Like, oh, goodness me, I have to keep on talking. Because it is not good to think about your timing. Just think about your story. Think about your story. If you run out of things to say, then it might be a good idea to go off topic. Lie if you have to. IELTS speaking is not based on facts or lies. You can just make something up just to, you know, keep it going. Because you did answer the question. You did go through the bullet points. So you answered the question. it is okay to go off topic. So if you are talking about an important phone call, you can say, oh, I would like to talk about my friend too, who likes to talk on the phone all the time. So that is, you are going off slightly off topic. it is somehow related. You can do stuff like that. Just to make sure you keep the flow of speech and you speak for up to two.

samples.question: Do you like a house or an apartment?
samples.transcript: I like a house rather than an apartment because the house is bigger than an apartment. I have more space than an apartment. And in my whole life I have so many bad experiences with apartments.

samples.question: Do you prefer to study in the morning or in the evening?
samples.transcript: In the morning. In the morning. If I am in school, I prefer to study in the morning. I feel like the day is getting longer. But if I am studying at home, I have more privacy. Nobody is going to wake up before 8 a.m. in my house.
